result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon D Lomax was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery with Threat of Force, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime
PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

superMiscConds.notes: Outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If reconfined or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Payable joint and several with co-defendant in 14CF93.

Outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If reconfined or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Pay the costs of supervision.    Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.
Commensurate with his treatment needs, defendant to obtain his GED, HSED or it's equivalent.  Seek and maintain employment approved by his agent.

Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.

Defendant shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, or by any other means, including but not limited to, Internet or Facebook, with the victims or their families, females under age 18, his co-defendant, John Cook in Jackson County Case No. 14CF93, or the minor Z.A., DOB:  9/2/98.  

No computer access, Internet or Facebook use without the knowledge and consent of his agent and treatment providers.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with extended supervision conditions.

Complete a sex offender assessment and comply with any recommended treatment or programming, if recommended by his agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Sentencing Hearing March 1, 2016
of the VNR to the victim V.K.
DNA submission form

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody, with Attorney Martinez.  Copy of facebook messages with the victim given to the court.  PSI has been received by the parties.  No changes or corrections noted.  Victim notification complied with.  The victim's mother M.L. in 15CF27, is present in court.  State recommended in 14CF94,   3 yrs IC 3-4 yrs ES.  In 15CF27,  2 yrs IC 2-3 year ES.  Concurrent to 14CF94.  No contact with the victims.  No contact with minor females.  Undergo sex offender treatment.  No access to computer or phone with Internet access.  Restitution, CC, costs of supervision.  Follow recommendations of agent.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.    Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.    Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  No contact with know illegal drug users or dealers.  Not eligible for CIP or SAR.  $99.95 restitution in 14CF94.  Joint and several with co-defendant J.C.  in 14CF93.  Victim's mother made a statement in court.  Attorney Martinez does not object to restitution.  369 days of credit.  He recommended in 14CF94,  1 year jail.   In 15CF27,  Probation, or an imposed and stayed prison sentence, or 18 month prison sentence.  Defendant elected to exercise his right to allocution.  Court ordered:  14CF94-  7 years total.   2 1/2 yrs IC 4 1/2 yrs ES.  $99.95 restitution in 14CF94.  Joint and several with co-defendant J.C.  in 14CF93.

15CF27-5 years total.  2 yrs IC, 3 years ES.  Concurrent to 14CF94.

Conditions:
No contact with the victims or their families.  No contact with co-defendant J.C. No contact with Z.A. DOB:   9/2/98.
No contact with any minor females.
Complete a sex offender assessment and comply with any recommended treatment or programming, if recommended by the agent.
No computer access, Internet or Facebook, use without consent of the agent and treatment providers.
Pay restitution, court costs, and supervision fees as directed.  DNA surcharge and sample. 
Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.
Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.
The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with ES conditions.
Commensurate with his treatment needs, obtain his GED, s/m employment.
Not eligible for CIP or SAP.  
369 days credit.

copy given to DA & defense attorney.  E-mailed to Judge.

ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  No other appearances.  PSI not filed yet.  Court has had no contact with Attorney Martinez.  New due date for PSI is 1/21.  Plea/sentencing rescheduled to 2/1/16 at 10:00 am.
from DOC to extend PSI due date.
Sentencing hearing at 01-04-2016 10:30 am

ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody and with Attorney Martinez.  Victim notification complied with.  Amended information filed with the court.  Defense acknowledged receipt of the amended information.  Defendant plead no contest to the amended count 4.  Court advised the charge and possible penalties of the count he plead to.  Counts 1, 2, 3 and 5 dismissed, but read in for sentencing purposes. Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, elements and constitutional rights waived with the Defendant.  He understood.  Felony warnings given.  Defense stipulated to a factual basis for the plea.  Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently entered his plea, and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found defendant guilty, as plead to.   Parties request PSI.  Due 12/15/15.  SEH set for 1/4/16 at 10:30 am.  Bond continued.
Restitution worksheet.
Plea hearing at 10-26-2015 10:30 am
Status conference at 09-28-2015 03:00 pm

ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody, with Attorney Martinez.  Defendant does not want to proceed today.  Attorney Martinez moves to withdraw as counsel.  Court asks defendant if he concurs.  He does.  Attorney Martinez will contact SPD.  Court reserves ruling on the motion to withdraw to see if SPD will appoint successor counsel.

Status conference at 06-29-2015 03:00 pm
And Notice of Witness List

Defendant appeared in custody with counsel Andrew Martinez.  DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Waiver of right to preliminary hearing on 15CF5, 15CF11, and 15CF27.  All cases set for status on 6-15-15 at 3:00.
Status conference at 06-15-2015 03:00 pm

Bond covers the following cases:  14CF94, 14CF152, 15CF5, 15CF11 and 15CF27.  Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals:  H.N.L., John Cook; Minor Z. A. & Zachary K.   Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  As a condition of your release, you must be available 24 hours per day, 7 days a week to submit to testing for alcohol when requested by a law enforcement officer or your probation agent. The defendant may submit to an alcohol test at the Jackson County Sheriff's Office or submit to a PBT by a law enforcement officer. Upon request, the defendant shall appear for and submit to testing within two (2) hours of the official's request.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle on the highways until properly reinstated in the State of Wisconsin.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  Until further order of the court you shall not leave the State of Wisconsin.
Status conference at 05-15-2015 02:30 pm
Preliminary hearing cancelled per request of Tanya Deerpalsing
Status conference at 04-29-2015 11:00 am
Preliminary hearing at 04-29-2015 11:15 am
Withdrawal of Counsel

Defendant appeared in custody from Jackson County Jail with counsel Erika Bahnson present in courtroom.  Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Attorney Bahnson motions the Court to allow her to withdraw due to breakdown of client/counsel relationship.  She states she will drop her files off at the SPDO after court this morning.  Defendant had demanded his preliminary hearing be held within the time limits.  Court makes a finding that there is good cause to go beyond the time limits as the SPDO will need to re-appoint new counsel.  Will continue day to day until new counsel is appointed.  DA Fox states that the main investigating officer will not be available from April 7 -11.  Defendant remanded to Jackson County Jail.
